bow: my theory on why connecting with other moms is hard find it hard to get to know other mom because we are all so busy hiding our authentic selves in order to come off as this good influence that society now expects us to be we do swear we do admit our true feelings and we do show our cards for fear of being judged by the bad mom police it isolating and makes it really hard to connect most of my friends are people who ve known since we were in our 20 to the outside world they seem just like all of the other mom meet cookie cutter and predictable but since know them in deeper level see this whole other side to them and they know me as full authentic person that more than just mom really doubt that if we met today we would have this deep of friendship maybe it because we hold so much in to try to keep strong front for our kids dunno but sometimes wonder of all these mom in my kids class who seem relatively alike which one would actually enjoy hanging out with if we were able to be more honest about who we are anyone relate to this totally totally agree with you watched bad moms and now workin moms on netflix and realized how much media plays in portraying what real motherhood is like granted these two are exaggerated to an extent but it so refreshing to see certain level of realness so fuck yeah us moms we re badasses but we re also all struggling one way or another so let lend our shoulders remove judgements and support each other yeah ve kind of self isolated have hard time making friends period but as tatted pierced sailor cursing atheist mom get really nervous trying to meet other moms also 24 with under and most people do have kids as young anymore so feel out of place age wise yes found one mom that tells it like it is and shoots straight we meet up often and talk about it all no judgement but apart from that no luck really hate being young mom sometimes 26 with three under three and get treated like teen mom by some women removed think the main reason connecting with other moms is hard is because you are trying to become friends with people just because they are mom too that not really connection you need to make friends based on ethics morals and or similar hobbies if they happen to be mom too great completely understand what you are saying there are many moms meet that get feeling we could be cool together if we were both willing to be vulnerable and admit we are human and that we enjoy things outside of our kids like elliekay47 too am tatted sailor cursing atheist mom so there is lot of preconceived notions think it is easiest to make friends with other moms if you don have expectations of what the outcome will be just show up to the parties make small talk and let your kids make the introductions eventually you have to move past shallow conversation ask another mom what she or her partner do for work if she knows of any mommy and me programs or kids events ask her anything about herself of course you will run into brick walls because there are women who aren interested in bringing new friends into their lives or they aren interested in you for some reason this doesn mean you have done something wrong it just means it won be good fit am 36 with year old and can tell you that the age of your kids being similar is more important than the age of the mothers being similar other moms are looking for friends too but you re going to have to put your neck out there and risk rejection the toughest part it making friends with another mom only to realize that you want to be friends with her but you don want your kid playing with hers because their behavior sucks ve had to put mom friends into categories girl night out friends and play date friends always here to talk find it really hard to have decent uninterrupted conversation while chasing toddler can for sure connect with and make new friends with women who also happen to be moms like new work friends or neighbors but moms at the park or moms dropping their kid off at school are like me multitasking already so it just hard to have meaningful conversation 25 and only have one but also tatted pierced sailor cursing mom let band together 26 and have year old and it was weird how because some of the moms in groups am are like years older then me they make me feel like baby some how even going as far as couldn imagine having baby at 23 it made me feel excluded so just kept to myself exactly months and not having any type of positive thoughts not even my best friend is helping out and feeling attacked by him for expressing my true feelings can only imagine if try to talk to anyone else that mom to be or already mom agree with this think op has valid point too but do really get it when hear people say that they do get along with other moms moms are just women who have children it large and diverse part of the population we re not all essential oil loving anti vaxxing mlm tycoons like some facebook groups would have you believe do you mean months pregnant if so congratulations that so exciting sorry to hear you are not getting lot of help support from your bestie that sucks my experience is that most reddit mummies are always willing to offer internet support for what it worth would respectfully disagree with you child is like hobby since having my baby am very much focused on baby stuff and like talking about baby stuff and do so with other mums similar as if would be very much into football and talk with another person about football it just depends on the person other interests whether the relationship goes beyond being just mum or football friends but as starting point for interacting being mum is great yes agree not going to be friends with someone just because we both have kids and desperate for friends if we both have the same morals and like doing the same stuff making friend off of that feel out of place age wise too barely 23 with year old most of my friends are getting engaged or just now married it extremely difficult for me especially as ve just moved to new city where know next to no one know young mom but when go to the park everyone with kid my daughters age is like 10 years older it intimidating to try to make friends that way yeah it pretty crazy people also assume that must be religious to be married with kids so young or that uneducated have never worked but was in the military and am currently in college and work part time job lol yeah had friends like that we would all hang but had to stop because their kids were passing off their bad habits behaviors to mine removed yeah it really is often feel like people take my young age as go ahead to start telling me how to parent which is infuriating oof haven so much had that and really hope don hobby is something done in leisure time for pleasure would politely argue that if someone says their children are their hobby they don have any hobbies you can enjoy being mom and not want or need any hobbies or even just other people my age sans kids get really self righteous and judge how do things even though they have zero experience on the subject ve had people give me crap about having one right after the other bed sharing nursing letting my toddler decide nap time etc everyone has an opinion was 22 when had my first and 24 when had my second and totally understand where you re coming from it does get better and you ll look back on this time fondly however the day to day is really tough mine are almost out of the house now which is insane my favorite quotation regarding this is the days are long but the years are fast you got this mama feel you see be your friend same soaking up my days with my girls hoping that with part time work and school ll be able to meet more people and make friends thank you woot woot let be friends feel the same can connect with other moms looking for real down to earth authentic moms to hang with but they all seem too cookie cutter for me like you said though they might be hiding who they truly are like all of us can do sometimes just want someone to chill with talk about everything with and just support one another 25 and it hard to meet anyone close to my age people think crazy for getting married and having kid young but love it wish had someone to talk and connect with my only best friend is childless and doesn get it she tries though yay made friend 26 with year old facial piercings and shaved head get lot of people making faces at me behind my back it awesome can see this being true but only for half of them ll admit becoming mom made me way less concerned with other people wear what want say what want and am passionate about our parenting style so will debate til blue in the face but also confrontational by nature when became mom *stopped* putting on perfect face for everyone around me and ve been way more true to myself than ever before and it throws people off in big way guess see it as learning experience for my own boys want them to see their mama as the same woman in our home and in the world so do placate anyone or let things slide or shy away from embarrassing or weird mom stuff and the few mom friends ve made have all been other women like me who are very open about their lifestyles and problems and whatever else is necessarily normal when ve gone to mom groups stand out and feel super judged but just do care and do return to situations where people are giving me weird looks because do want my kids to think have to act certain way around certain people yes months pregnant and thank you but not so excited that why don talk to anyone online most don even know how to handle anything than happy comments agree so hard there actually lot of research on why it harder to make friends as we get older and ithink the challenges with that include why it is hard to make mom friends this old but still relevant nyt article https www nytimes com 2012 07 15 fashion the challenge of making friends as an adult html browse incognito if you have already used your free articles for the month talks about the three factors necessary for making lasting friendships proximity repeated unplanned interactions and setting that encourages vulnerability think yoir point about always being on as mom gets at that vulnerability factor the fear of being judged makes it hard to truly let your guard down weird queer polyamorous mama in very straight laced suburb so definitely feel that also think the random unplanned interactions gets to lot of it like always chat up moms at the park but then we do run into each other more than once month and we have seen enough of each other to make exchanging contact information comfortable interaction it all hard 23 with almost yr old and almost yr old super socially awkward couple tattoos and some language as well felt this so hard removed tattooed atheist swearing mom two kids by 21 had number and 28 we are now friends tattooed pierced in my 30s but look younger vegetarian raising vegetarian kids extremely liberal cursing pagan witch mom feel you if you re near detroit let be bff it funny how regions can be so different 30 and feel ancient compared to the other moms who are all 20 lol can really relate to this if anything ve become more unapologetically authentic since becoming mom don have the energy to care what look like to anyone but my son the biggest barrier for me is the fact that had my first kid at 30 and all moms with child my age are way younger that am the rest my age either have too many kids to allow to bother making new friends or don have kids at all and can connect with me anymore yay friends wish was in omaha snore working towards going vegan had some setbacks because my brother lives with us and we share dinner duties and they occasionally cook meals with meat my husband is pagan think people get kick out of the fact atheist and he pagan lol but it works may be 32 no tattoos previously pierced but curse do make friends easy and am atheist all are my type of people man would love to live somewhere like omaha but little too freaked about tornadoes ripping my home apart michigan does get much extreme weather but am so sick of it here love the east coast but hurricanes love the plains but tornados honestly do get this maybe just the type of person who can chat with anyone but have made so many mum friends since my son birth having young baby is so all consuming you have something major in common so conversation is easy who cares if they are into the same bands and tv shows it not like you re looking for girlfriends to goto gigs with the problem see us people just being shy and not trying to chat with people goto some baby groups and make big fuss of your baby making friends with some other baby get chatting with the babies mum ask her to go get coffee after bingo mum friends tattooed vegan raising vegan kids extremely liberal atheist mom ll probably face similar obstacles finding mom friends don live near or in detroit unfortunately boo well ve lived on both coasts and the plains both times ve lived through hurricane earthquake or tornado it been mild and my property has been affected omaha is actually pretty nice just kiss the mountains removed probably true if anyone who lives in seattle wants to be their self around me ll be moving out there with my one year old in few months by the way me too sending love to all the young mamas out there sounds very lonely was exactly young 29 when had my first but lived in san francisco where everyone tends to wait until late 30 to have kids none of my friends had kids they were all still partying so get that feeling live in omaha pick me pick me ll be in cornfield waiting for friends same here none of my friends have kids yet 27 with my first who is 4mos tatted pierced vegan liberal bedsharing mum in one of the most hippy places ever and still all the other mums are late 30s early 40s old people with adopted kids 🤷🏼‍♀️ 33 atheist and currently getting told off by my 75 year old any time curse that teacher says that potty word also live in the bible belt so yeah it been hard making mom friends swear in front of my kids they re going to learn the words elsewhere might as well be me they know are learning when and where the use of them are appropriate also have tattoos and piercings am not pto mom because ca stand the ridiculousness of the specific group of moms at my child school ve made very good friends with other moms that think and act like me where can be myself with and ve made tenative friends with my kids moms so my kids can enjoy their friend motherhood is such weird world and culture social media moms on like instagram make me feel so inadequate because only see their over the top highlight reel and not the tantrums kids in pjs all day etc do my best to be authentic so the friends do make are legitimate and genuine relationships it taken long time to just be honest in my role as mother and making mom friends but feel secure in the friendships have made thus far just be yourself and you ll find your person the uneducated never worked one gets to me have master degree for goodness sake removed have trouble finding good place to reply to this but you all sound like awesome people wish was in omaha detroit lol your kid living in the bible belt tops my seattle freeze woes make guess that you re an introvert as well hmmm guess congratulations and gushing about how exciting it is are much easier than facing any of the many reasons someone might not be excited about their pregnancy sorry you re feeling that way pregnancies are hard enough without that going on thank you yeah it was isolating right off the bat because had stepson at 21 and everyone was in party mode too lmfao waiting in cornfield let do it ve been to so few places ve lived here four years and just went to the coneflower creamery like yesterday jeez that crazy lucky that at least my only friend here has similar views as me so have that going but my parents are very conservative and have old fashioned views luckily they keep them to themselves for the most part it insane people look at mom especially stay at home moms regardless of age and judge them so much and make so many assumptions they look right passed me and talk to my husband like not even there and then he points them to me most of the time because handle everything make all the decisions and am more knowledgeable about lot of shit in my own respective field called out friend of his we were out one time because he was like oh well you would want to do that job and was like why because woman or because have kids and he just started sputtering like oh that not what meant it just such physical job you would want to do all that heavy lifting just stared at him and was like you do realize have black belt in karate and am aircrew in the military right yes the lack of decent uninterrupted conversation while you have toddler is what find to be the biggest roadblock as well my daughter is 17 months and while very much enjoying her exploration and all her new tricks have resigned myself to the fact that my current friendships and any new ones are on hold until she older and little more independent am constantly interrupted mid sentence by my daughter screeching climbing something or pulling thumbtack out of god knows where so just do bother trying to have conversations unless not with her at all for now hear that lot as well the could imagine having baby at age well people have baby at age every day so idk what to tell ya man when was pregnant with my first was able to be excited about it for the first few weeks and then my life and relationship quickly fell apart knowing would likely be single mom made it very hard to be excited about my pregnancy that real life for ya if you want to vent here it hard making mom friends because it seems so simple like you have being mom in common but it easy to forget there is whole person behind the mom so you also have to click with the real person and that much harder to do pair that with me feeling like don fit in with many cookie cutter moms kind of keep to myself exactly that got ta be rough this is literally my life rn whatd you end up doing brunch happens here and there but only when theyre not hungover think this nails it for me really try to talk to women in my mum group about what they do did outside of babies to find point of connection yeah it sucked lost pretty much all of my friends because did want to party all the time and was committed to my then boyfriend and his son basically what feeling only with little twist er told me was supposed to miscarry and bf wasn supportive got back home and the next day they tell me it healthy fetus with an additional two weeks than what was told week ago so came back in hope to work things out can only keep on dreaming they really are just the hormones going haywire itself like to blame them for how feeling most of the time it easier to be happy or hopeful in some situations especially relating to child tbh it kind of sad story was in an emotionally abusive relationship and he was still partying with all of our old friends staying out all hours of the night we eventually moved out of the city for financial reasons and think it was his effort to put our little family first unfortunately the relationship was just too toxic and ended up moving back to my home town to be closer to my family when finally left him was months pregnant with my second child do hang out with any of those people anymore but ironically my old bff just got pregnant finally decided to give up partying and has reached out to me for support funny how life happens so yeah now single mom in small town who sucks at making mom friends lol hope your friends and so are little more supportive than that ♥️ aw glad had the strength to get out of that situation have exactly two friends out here because moved cross country year ago lol in need of real in person interaction my mom group skews bit older and the town is tad bougie so feel like need little bit of wall up and can really be myself myself wasn going to do anything about it but seeing ur post is inspiring me to find more moms thank you and so glad to have inspired you do know if you ve ever tried meetup before but it might be good place to start keep telling myself to get on there but something about meeting up with people ve never met sparks my stranger anxiety lol good luck rooting for you good for you it sounds like you have it figured out teacher so most of the parents encounter at school probably censor themselves around me and of course expected to sensor myself around them because of my position maybe that part of the problem for me also probably care to much what other ppl think tbh envy your ability to be so carefree hear you was playing with the idea of being teacher for awhile and knew would have to reel in my personality to be able to be respected by parents and administration that adds whole different variable to finding mom friends as parents we expect teachers to be significant examples for our kids so that tough not sure where you are located but did find some of my best mom friends through moms club via meetup com few others found others through my hobby of knitting also made irl friends via an atheism fb mom group and then have younger friends that are yet moms through my studies at university it feels like it kind of just fell into place but when think about it did have to put myself out there and get burned by some it sucks but the friendships do have were worth it its basically like dating you see someone you think would be cool and somehow start talking to them exchange numbers or social media and then just feel it out hope you find your people think we all are guilty of judgment before truly taking time to get to know each other always assume other moms don like me and because of that have struggled to connect the way it seems other moms do probably putting off weird vibe because think being judged simply based on many of the comments here we all struggle with similar issues and we probably all feel so many of the same struggles emotions and triumphs believe it comes down to being honest vulnerable and breaking down the walls we build mommy ing is hard tiring stressful and exhausting at times we are probably not functioning at our best at least not always plus self judgment is real struggle that lot of us deal with like most challenges we face in life if we work at approaching each other with an open heart and an open mind we can get past it but not saying it easy have three kids and most of my closest friends do not have any that may be part of the problem for me personally ❤️ society is so surface these days everything is super quick so you do have time to delve into the depths and get to really truly know people agree with this it hard to have nuanced it does always seem like it but most people do feel isolated regardless of lifestyle and the weird part is we all do it to ourselves fall victim to it too try to be the friend want to have also find
